result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J Mendieta Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Costs paid in full.  Balance to be refunded to poster.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new law violations.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions.  Sentence commencing forthwith.  Sentence credit of 42 days was granted.
To be performed as a condition of probation.

Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 8 dismissed and read in.  Bail remains as fixed penting sentencing.  Patrick Ryan is available for the next hearing. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   The Defendant may be removed from  GPS monitoring.

Defendant Kevin J Mendieta Ramirez in court with attorney Matt Last.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Dawn Maldonado appears in person.  The Court calls the case to address the bail motion filed by Attorney Last.  Attorney Last requests the bail be modified to remove the condition of GPS monitoring and lower the bail amount to $5,000.00 cash.  The State does not object to GPS monitoring being removed as a bail condition but the State does object to any modification in the amount of bail set.  The Court grants the removal of the GPS monitoring but the amount of $10,000.00 and all other conditions of bail remains as set.

Defendant Kevin J Mendieta Ramirez in court, in custody, with attorney Matt Last.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  The Court calls the matter to address the bail motion filed by Attorney Last.  Attorney Last requests the Court modify the bail from cash to a signature bond. The State objects to any bail modification and bail remain as set.  The Court modifies the bond to $10,000.00 cash bond with an added condition of GPS monitoring and all other previous conditions set by the Court.  Attorney Last has received partial discovery but not an offer at this time.  Attorney Last to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Patrick Ryan is available for next hearing. Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
